content.question: The architects who rebuilt Chartres Cathedral after a fire in 1194 C.E. employed an innovative ground plan and flying buttresses that became exemplary of High Gothic churches by enabling

choices.label: the construction of a circular dome over the rectangular base of the transept
the construction of an ambulatory that allowed for more efficient flow of visitors
an increase in the height of the central nave while also allowing for enlarged clerestory windows
an increase in the height of the side aisles to the level of the nave, thereby creating a wide-open interior

content.answer: an increase in the height of the central nave while also allowing for enlarged clerestory windows

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Explain the meaning or significance of continuity and/or change between works of art (or groups of related works of art) within a related artistic tradition, style, or practice.
